newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Electrabel in 7.0 bln bfr power plant.
newsitem.headline: Electrabel in 7.0 bln bfr power plant.

text.p: Belgian energy supplier Electrabel said on Thursday it and GEC-Alsthom signed a deal worth seven billion francs for the construction of a new power station in Baudour, southern Belgium, creating 200 jobs.
The deal will also involve orders for local suppliers, including CMI for the boiler, ACEC for the control room. Hamont for the air condenser and TEE for supervision.
The plant is part of the federal government's national generating equipment plan for 1995 to 2000.
The power station will be a steam and gas turbine plant with a generating capacity of 360 000 kW.
"This kind of power station is especially environment-friendly since it runs on natural gas and delivers an energy yield of 56 per cent," Electrabel said in a statement.
The energy yield of a conventional coal or natural gas-fired power station never exceeds 40 per cent.
